Unnest a tibble containing a list-column of tbl_time objects

When a tbl_time object is nested by tidyr::nest(), the outer object is often a tibble, and the nested list-column contains tbl_time objects. This allows you to unnest that list-column and retain time information.

time_unnest(data, ...)

Arguments

data

A tibble containing a list-column of tbl_time objects.
...

Passed on to tidyr::unnest().

Examples


data(FANG)
FANG <- as_tbl_time(FANG, date) %>%
   group_by(symbol)

FANG_nested <- tidyr::nest(FANG)

# FANG_nested is not a `tbl_time` anymore
class(FANG_nested)
#> [1] "tbl_df"     "tbl"        "data.frame"

# The list column contains the `tbl_time` objects because they have the
# index.
class(FANG_nested$data[[1]])
#> [1] "tbl_time"   "tbl_df"     "tbl"        "data.frame"

# Unnest and keep time information
time_unnest(FANG_nested)
#> # A time tibble: 4,032 x 8
#> # Index: date
#>    symbol       date  open  high   low close    volume adjusted
#>  *  <chr>     <date> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>
#>  1     FB 2013-01-02 27.44 28.18 27.42 28.00  69846400    28.00
#>  2     FB 2013-01-03 27.88 28.47 27.59 27.77  63140600    27.77
#>  3     FB 2013-01-04 28.01 28.93 27.83 28.76  72715400    28.76
#>  4     FB 2013-01-07 28.69 29.79 28.65 29.42  83781800    29.42
#>  5     FB 2013-01-08 29.51 29.60 28.86 29.06  45871300    29.06
#>  6     FB 2013-01-09 29.67 30.60 29.49 30.59 104787700    30.59
#>  7     FB 2013-01-10 30.60 31.45 30.28 31.30  95316400    31.30
#>  8     FB 2013-01-11 31.28 31.96 31.10 31.72  89598000    31.72
#>  9     FB 2013-01-14 32.08 32.21 30.62 30.95  98892800    30.95
#> 10     FB 2013-01-15 30.64 31.71 29.88 30.10 173242600    30.10
#> # ... with 4,022 more rows
